item.title: Report E-2024050037
item.description:
Report E-2024050037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 25, 2024, six (6) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit due to no dunnage and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pails were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for further disposal.

item.description:
Report I-2024030022

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T00:31:13+00:00

  • City: HOUSTON

  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Car was found to be non compliant during FRA inspection for loose manway bolts, subsequently the car was found to leak from under the dome lid while being moved to a repair spot, our contract Haz-Mat response team was called out and found that there was no dome lid gasket, one was applied and the manway bolts were secured as required.

item.title: Report X-2024050179
item.description:
Report X-2024050179

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: WACO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Judy Roberson CSR stated while unloading trailer 571649 a tote of UN2031, NITRIC ACID, 8 (5.1), PG II, was leading and has spilled in the trailer. Judy stated it looked to be 16oz that spilled on the trailer floor. Judy stated the tote was moved out of the trailer and on to the dock floor at door 2 . Judy stated it looked to be the top cover of the tote is where it was leaking. Judy stated the tote is on the dock floor waiting on a crew to assist with the cleaning of the spill and to check the top cover of the tote.

item.title: Report I-2024030025
item.description:
Report I-2024030025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: PASADENA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Car was reporting leaking from under the dome lid, Haz-Mat Special Services our contract Haz-Mat Response Team was engaged immediately, upon inspection it was noted that 7 of the eight swing bolts were less than tool-tight and there was no dome gasket on the car. HMSS applied a gasket and tightened the bolts on the dome lid as required.

item.title: Report X-2024050124
item.description:
Report X-2024050124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1 OF THE LIDS WASNT SECURED FOR TRANSPORTATION CAUSING SOME OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK OUT. HAZMAT WAS FOUND PILED UNDER NC'S AT THE BACK OF TRAILER 807063. PACKAGE DID NOT SHOW ANY SIGNS OF BEING CRUSHED FROM NC'S BUT WAS NOT PROPERLY LOADED INTO THE TRAILER AND WAS LAYING ON ITS SIDE. CORROSIVE LIQUID SPILT FROM CONTAINER AND LEAKED ONTO AN ALTERNATE PACKAGE (273866476870) ALTERNATE PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE ANY DAMAGE TO THE CONTENTS INSIDE AND SHOWED ONLY DAMAGE TO THE EXTERIOR OF THE PACKAGE FROM THE CORROSIVE LIQUID.

  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET PACKAGE FOUND IN TRAILER# 952850 ALREADY DAMAGED WET UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 1 X 5 GALLON PLASTIC DRUM/PAIL OF URESOLVE 411 THE 5 GALLON PLASTIC DRUM/PAIL HAD A LOOSE CAP ALLOWING .50 GALLONS TO RELEASE NO SLOTTED PARTITIONS BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

  • Description: DMP RECEIVED A CALL TO DOOR 24 FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. WHEN THE RESPONDER ARRIVED FOUND THAT THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS A HAZMAT. THE HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS CLENAED UP FOLLOWING ALL DMP PROCEDURES AND BROUGHT BACK TO DMP. ONCE IN DMP, PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED FOLLOWING ALL PROCEDURES WITHOUT INCIDENT.

item.title: Report E-2024050022
item.description:
Report E-2024050022

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 24, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon plastic jug of UN2922 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN2922-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 22, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.
